social_background.income: Resides in nursing home, $72.80/month personal needs via Medicaid; family provides extras
social_background.substance_use: No smoking, alcohol, or illicit drug use

medical_history.health_perception: Unable to recall events due to severe dementia. Per nursing home staff and family, CHF was stable before admission. Last cardiology appointment ~6 months ago. Declining oral intake and frequent falls raise concern for failure to thrive.

mental_health.status: Severe dementia with behavioral disturbance; initial ICU stay required frequent sedation due to agitation; now acclimated. Agitation and confusion worsen in unfamiliar environments.

functional_status.mobility: Ambulates with supervision but has had more than 3 falls in past month due to unsteady gait and fatigue. Not appropriate for PT/OT due to cognitive impairment and inability to use walker.

continence.urinary: Incontinent, wears briefs; with prompting can use toilet after meals
continence.bowel: Incontinent, wears briefs; with prompting can use toilet after meals

appointments_and_support.major_support: Nursing home level care, supportive husband and daughter
appointments_and_support.follow_up: Routinely followed by nursing home providers; cardiology follow-up 6 months ago

er_admission.history_of_present_illness: Presented to ED with increasing SOB at rest over 2 days, 8lb weight gain in 1 week, poor diuretic response, and electrolyte abnormalities. Chest X-ray: pulmonary congestion, cardiomegaly. ECG: Atrial fibrillation with rapid ventricular rate (HR 115–125).

current_medications: Docusate sodium (Colace) 100mg PO twice a day
Furosemide (Lasix) 40mg PO twice a day **(ON HOLD due to IV Lasix)**
Metoprolol succinate ER (Toprol XL) 25mg PO daily

nutrition_and_gi.diet: No added salt (NAS), soft and bite-sized, thin liquids
nutrition_and_gi.supplements: Ensure 8oz TID between meals and bedtime
nutrition_and_gi.GI_status: Abdomen round, smooth skin, no distention. Normal bowel sounds. Tympany noted, no masses or tenderness. Tolerating diet well. No GI concerns reported.
nutrition_and_gi.appetite: Poor baseline appetite per nursing facility

urinary.behavior: Will sometimes use toilet with prompting after meals

bowel.behavior: Will sometimes use toilet with prompting after meals

sensory_and_sleep.sleep: Frequently awake at night, wanders the unit; often falls asleep in chair

braden_scale.sensory_perception: 3 - Slightly limited: Responds to verbal commands but cannot always communicate discomfort or need to be turned
braden_scale.moisture: 2 - Moist: Skin is often but not always moist. Linen must be changed at least once a shift.
braden_scale.activity: 3 - Walks occasionally: Walks short distances with or without assistance. Spends majority of time in bed or chair.
braden_scale.mobility: 3 - Slightly limited: Makes frequent but slight changes in body or extremity position independently.
braden_scale.nutrition: 2 - Probably Inadequate: Rarely eats a full meal. Protein intake ~3 servings/day. Occasionally takes supplements.
braden_scale.friction_and_shear: 2 - Potential problem: Moves feebly, may slide during movement. Maintains position most of the time but occasionally slides.

self_perception.behavior: Initially required sedation in ICU due to agitation from cognitive impairment. Now acclimated with frequent family presence.

roles_and_relationships.husband: Visits daily for lunch, brings treats from coffee shop
roles_and_relationships.daughter: Healthcare proxy, very supportive and involved

sexuality_and_reproduction.objective: Resides in nursing home, not sexually active; has 3 children

coping_and_stress_tolerance.observations: Cognitive impairment leads to agitation and confusion in unfamiliar settings; family involvement (esp. husband) helps reduce stress; husband attempts to walk her around unit

values_and_beliefs.current_observance: Attends weekly mass at facility, but often wanders off shortly after
